thread.title: Eight Black Stars players arrive in camp ahead of Canada frienldy
thread.title_full: Eight Black Stars players arrive in camp ahead of Canada frienldy

title: Eight Black Stars players arrive in camp ahead of Canada frienldy
text:
Sports News | 9 October 2015 23:00 CET Eight Black Stars players arrive in camp ahead of Canada frienldy By GNA 
Accra, Oct. 9, GNA - Members of the senior national team, the Black Stars have started arriving in camp ahead of their international friendly game against Canada next week in Washington DC, United States of America (USA). 
The Stars who are scheduled to commence training on Friday evening, already have in camp, Italy based duo of Afriyie Acquah and Alfred Duncan and goalkeeper Razak Brimah from Spain. 
Information gathered by the GNA Sports reveals that, Germany based Phil Ofosu-Ayeh, who received his debut call, has also joined camp, whilst USA based Harrison Afful has also joined his colleagues. 
Also in camp is Middlesbrough winger Albert Adomah. 
The team is expected to shape up by the close of Friday and Saturday as they prepare for the international friendly. 
A local contingent which includes Black Stars management committee chairman George Afriyie, assistant coach Maxwell Konadu, goalkeeper Fatau Dauda and other officials are also expected to join the team on Friday ahead of Tuesday's friendly. 
Black Stars Coach Avram Grant has already been in the United States where he has been scouting ahead of the game. 
GNA
